commands.name: init
commands.description: Create an empty Git repository or reinitialize an existing one

usage.description: Create an empty Git repository or reinitialize an existing one
Create Git repository with template directory contents

commands.name: clone
commands.description: Creates a local copy of a project that already exists remotely

usage.description: Clone target repository
Clone a repository with branch-name checked out
Clones target repository with history truncated to depth

commands.name: submodule
commands.description: Initialize, update or inspect submodules

usage.description: Adds url as submodule
Initializes local config file
Fetch all data from submodule
Updates local submodule
If submodule cannot be reached somehow, sync command will help you resync your config

commands.name: add
commands.description: Stages changes in the working tree

usage.description: Adds given file to stage area
Adds all files within given folder
Adds all extension files to stage area
Interactively choose hunks of patch between the index and the work tree and add them to the index

commands.name: status
commands.description: Shows the status of changes as untracked, modified, or staged

usage.description: Changed files on your working directory
Give the output in the short-format
Show the branch and tracking info even in short-format

commands.name: diff
commands.description: Shows file differences not yet staged

usage.description: Show changes all changes between the working tree and the index
Show changes to a file between the working tree and the index

commands.name: commit
commands.description: Saves the snapshot to the project history

usage.description: Use the given message as the commit message. If multiple -m usage are given, their values are concatenated as separate paragraphs
Tell the command to automatically stage files that have been modified and deleted, but new files you have not told Git about are not affected
Updates the last commit without creating a new commit
Create a single commit on top of the current branch

commands.name: stash
commands.description: Stash and restore incomplete changes

usage.description: Shows all your stashes
Saves your local modifications to a new stash entry
Applies the stash in index
Applies the stash in index and removes it from stash list
Removes the index from stash list without applying
Clears the stash list

commands.name: rm
commands.description: Remove files from the index

usage.description: Removes file from stage area

commands.name: mv
commands.description: Move or rename a file or a directory

usage.description: Moves or renames source
Forces to move or rename the source even if it exists in destination

commands.name: tag
commands.description: Marks the current commit with a tag

usage.description: Lists all tags
Marks the current commit with a [tag-name]
Marks the [commit-hash] commit with a [tag-name]
Marks the current commit with an annotated [tag-name] such as v1.4
Delete existing tags with the given [tag-name]

commands.name: branch
commands.description: List, rename, create, or delete branches

usage.description: Lists tracked branches
List both remote-tracking branches and local branches
Creates a new branch from HEAD called [branch-name]
Rename current branch to [branch-name]
Delete [branch-name]. The branch must be fully merged in its upstream branch, or in HEAD if no upstream was set with --track or --set-upstream

commands.name: switch
commands.description: Switch or create branches

usage.description: Switches to a branch called [branch-name]
Creates and switches to a new branch from HEAD called [branch-name]
Creates and switches to a new branch from [start-point] called [branch-name]
Creates a new orphan branch called [branch-name] and removes all tracked files

commands.name: checkout
commands.description: Switch branches or restore working tree files

usage.description: Switch to [branch-name] or restore working tree files
Create and switch to [branch-name] or restore working tree files
Checkout and track a remote branch
Discard all tracked local changes in HEAD
Resets tracked [source] file/folder

commands.name: fetch
commands.description: Downloads all history from the remote repository

usage.description: Fetch all remotes
Before fetching, remove any remote-tracking references that no longer exist on the remote

commands.name: pull
commands.description: Updates the local branch from its remote counterpart

usage.description: Fetch from and integrate with another repository or a local branch

commands.name: push
commands.description: Uploads all local branch commits to its remote counterpart

usage.description: Update remote refs along with associated objects
Overwrite remote refs with your local branch
Prevents overwriting remote refs with your local branch

commands.name: merge
commands.description: Combines the specified branchâ€™s history into the current branch

usage.description: Merges a branch to your current HEAD

commands.name: rebase
commands.description: Rebase your current HEAD onto target branch

usage.description: Rebase your current HEAD onto branch-name
Makes a list of the commits which are about to be rebased. User can edit that list before rebasing.
Continue a rebase after resolving conflicts
Abort a rebase

commands.name: cherry-pick
commands.description: Apply the changes from a different commit to your current HEAD

usage.description: Pick and apply changes from commit hash to your current HEAD

commands.name: reset
commands.description: Undoes all commits after [commit], preserving changes locally

usage.description: Resets the index entries for all paths to their state
Does not touch the index file or the working tree at all
Resets the index but not the working tree and reports what has not been updated
Resets the index and working tree. Any changes to tracked files in the working tree since commit are discarded

commands.name: revert
commands.description: Removes all changes made by commits from repository

usage.description: Revert to the latest commit
Revert to the [commit-hash] commit
Revert to the [commit-hash] commit but do not commit

commands.name: clean
commands.description: Shows untracked files about to be removed

usage.description: Shows untracked files about to be removed
Removes all untracked files
Removes all ignored files
Runs clean command with interactive menu

commands.name: log
commands.description: Lists version history for the current branch

usage.description: Show all commits
Shows all commits as graph
Show changes to file

commands.name: config
commands.description: Get and set repository or global usage

usage.description: Edit repository config file
Edit global config file
Define your user name in global settings
Define your mail in global settings

commands.name: gc
commands.description: Cleanup unnecessary files and optimize the local repository

usage.description: Runs a garbage collection for your local repository
Runs gc more aggressively to optimize your local repository

commands.name: prune
commands.description: Prune all unreachable objects from the object database

usage.description: Removes objects that are no longer pointed to any object in reachable branch
Do not remove anything; just report what it would remove
Shows prune progress

commands.name: bisect
commands.description: Use binary search to find the commit that introduced a bug

usage.description: Start up the git bisect wizard
Let the git bisect wizard know of a good commit
Let the git bisect wizard know of a bad commit
End your git bisect wizard

commands.name: blame
commands.description: Display author metadata attached to specific committed lines in a file

usage.description: Show each author worked on the source including date, time and line numbers
Restrict the output of source between x and y lines
Show author email address instead of username
Ignore whitespace changes
